TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SignedInfo extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Contains information about the canonicalization algorithm and signature algorithm used for the XML signature.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SignedInfo class represents the <`SignedInfo`> element of an XML signature defined by the XML digital signature specification. The <`SignedInfo`> element, which is a subelement of the <`Signature`> element, contains the canonicalization method used for signing, the algorithm used for signing and validation, and references that describe a digital signature.
For most scenarios, you should use the SignedInfo class available from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.SignedInfo%2A> property to sign and verify XML digital signatures.
For more information about the <`SignedInfo`> element, see the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddReference(class System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Reference reference) cil managed

Docs.param: The reference to add to the list of references.
Docs.summary: Adds a object to the list of references to digest and sign.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The AddReference method adds a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Reference> object to a collection that is accessible using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.References%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the canonicalization algorithm that is used before signing for the current object.
Docs.value: The canonicalization algorithm used before signing for the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The CanonicalizationMethod property uses a string Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) to represent the <`Canonicalization`> element of an XML digital signature. Use the CanonicalizationMethod property to specify the canonicalization algorithm applied to the XML output of the class before performing signature calculations. Use one of the URIs listed in the following table with this property. |Canonicalization Method|Value| |-----------------------------|-----------| |Canonical XML|http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315

This is default method. Also defined in the following static field: | |Canonical XML with comments|http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315#WithComments

Also defined in the following static field: | |Exclusive Canonical XML|http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#

Also defined in the following static field: | |Exclusive Canonical XML with comments|http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#WithComments

Also defined in the following static field: | For more information about XML digital signatures, see the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.

Docs.summary: Gets a object used for canonicalization.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The CanonicalizationMethodObject property contains the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform> object used by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml> class to canonicalize an XML document before signing or verifying.
The CanonicalizationMethodObject property is read-only. You can modify the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform> object within this property by passing the desired transform Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.CanonicalizationMethod%2A> property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the Id property to add a string ID to the XML representation of the current <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo> element. The ID is used to reference the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo> from another location.

Docs.summary: Gets a list of the objects of the current object.
Docs.value: A list of the elements of the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The References property uses a list of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Reference> objects to represent the `<Reference>` elements of an XML digital signature.
Use the References property to describe the transforms, digest algorithms, and digest values of an XML digital signature.
For more information about XML digital signatures, see the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the length of the signature for the current object.
Docs.value: The length of the signature for the current object.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the algorithm used for signature generation and validation for the current object.
Docs.value: The name of the algorithm used for signature generation and validation for the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SignatureMethod property uses a string Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) to represents the `` element of an XML digital signature. Use the SignatureMethod property to specify the algorithm to use for signature generation and verification. This property identifies all cryptographic functions involved in creating an XML digital signature, including hashing, public key algorithms, Message Authentication Codes (MACs), and padding. Use one of the URIs in the following table with this property. |Signature Method|Value| |----------------------|-----------| |HMAC-SHA1|http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#hmac-sha1

Also defined in the following static field: | |DSA with SHA1|http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#dsa-sha1

Also defined in the following static field: | |RSA with SHA1|http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1

Also defined in the following static field: | For more information about XML digital signatures, see the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) [XML Signature Syntax and Processing Specification](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/).

Docs.summary: Gets an object to use for synchronization.
Docs.value: An object to use for synchronization.
